definition: harmful teachings/evil doctrine
demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: Half-truth and hearsay was called truth.
sentences.chinese: 似是而非及異端邪說被視爲真理。

sentences.english: He is spreading this heresy everywhere .
sentences.chinese: 他要把異端邪說到處傳播。

sentences.english: Several heads were symbolic of decadence and oppression, and also of heresy.
sentences.chinese: 幾個頭是象徵性的衰落和壓迫，和並且異端邪說。
所有的這些都是異端邪說。

sentences.english: But will the embers of a different kind of heresy continue to burn?
sentences.chinese: 但不同種類的異端邪說的餘燼今後是否還會再燃？

sentences.english: Don't let yourself be taken in by such absurd deception.
sentences.chinese: 你不要被這些歪理邪說矇騙了。

sentences.english: He was charged with heresy and arrested by the lnquisition.
sentences.chinese: 他被控告信奉邪說，後被宗教法庭逮捕。

sentences.english: As a result, many of my comments will seem heretical to the high-level language purists out there.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我的許多意見將是被視爲高階語言的邪說。

sentences.english: It means we don’t get polluted with heretical ideas from outside.
sentences.chinese: 意味着我們可以不受外來邪說的污染。

sentences.english: It might be considered heresy to suggest such a notion.
sentences.chinese: 提出這樣一個觀點可能會被視爲異端邪說。

sentences.english: Continence is the foe of heresy.
sentences.chinese: 剋制是異端邪說的敵人。

sentences.english: Or will you use them to your own devious advantage?
sentences.chinese: 或將您使用他們自己的歪理邪說優勢？

sentences.english: The crumbling away of prejudices and errors causes light.
sentences.chinese: 邪說和謬見的崩潰造成了光明。
我們應該公開指責異端邪說。

sentences.english: Her belief that taxes should be higher was heresy .
sentences.chinese: 她認爲應該增加稅收，這是異端邪說。

sentences.english: I have been truly astonished at the number of people who believe his absurd deception.
sentences.chinese: 有那麼多人想念他的歪理邪說，我確實很喫驚。

definition: evil conduct
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
misconception/fallacy
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
Yang Zhu (c. 440-360 BC), Chinese philosopher advocating ethical egoism
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
political enemy/opponent
shameful secret
lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
irreverent
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
traitor
